articles.title: Minister's Rohingya Tweet Triggers Delhi vs Centre Fight Over Refugees
articles.description: Hours after Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri's tweets announcing homes and security for Rohingya refugees from Myanmar were contradicted by his own government, they set the stage for a new clash between the centre and the Delhi government.
articles.content:
PM Modi's government has previously tried to send back Rohingya refugees to Myanmar.

articles.title: "Will Withdraw Campaign In Bihar If...": Prashant Kishor
articles.description: Poll strategist-turned-politician Prashant Kishor on Wednesday asserted that if the newly formed 'Mahagathbandhan' government in Bihar provides five to 10 lakh jobs in the next one or two years, he would withdraw his 'Jan Suraj Abhiyan'.
articles.content:
The state will witness more political upheavals in the near future, Prashant Kishor said.

articles.title: Farmers Begin 3-Day Protest Against Centre In Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri
articles.description: 10,000 farmers who reportedly left from Punjab for Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri on Wednesday will participate in a 72-hour long protest against the Centre starting today.
articles.content:
Farmers are demanding the sacking of Union Minister of State Ajay Mishra.
Punjab: Nearly 10,000 farmers from Punjab will take part in a 72-hour protest in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri against the… [+1240 chars]

articles.title: Undo this harm, give me back my right to live: Bilkis Bano after release of rape convicts
articles.description: Two days after all the convicts serving a life sentence in the 2002 Bilkis Bano gang rape case were released from jail, Bano urged the Gujarat government to “undo this harm” and give her back the “right to live without fear and in peace”.
